\n< Serena >Excuse me. I came from the Adventurer's Guild.

\n< Female >Subordinate Yott! What's the deal with this
complaint handling!

\n< Female >It can't just be settled with a simple
warning! You should look into it
immediately! Right now!
\n< Female >Subordinate Yott! Where did you go!

\n< Female >What...? It's lunch break? I won't allow you to
even take a bite of bread until you
submit the report! Bring them back
immediately!
\n< Female >Subordinate Ahh! Subordinate Bee!

\n< Female >You bunch of children! Stick to that woman
until she says yes! Go!
\n< Female >Honestly, young people these days...
\n< Female >Hm? Who are you?
\n< Serena >......Hmm... I am an adventurer.

\n< Serena >Um, I came here to take on a request from
the guild...

\n< Female >Guild? Adventure... Ah, I see. Is it about the
investigation? That's right, that's
right.
\n< Female >Alright, let's talk. Come over here.

\n< Female >First of all... I think we need
introductions.

\n< Nicola >I am Nicola. I am the captain of the
Royal Guard, directly under His Majesty
the King.
\n< Serena >I'm Serena.

\n< Serena >...Nicola? That's an unusual name around here.
It's not commonly used for women.

\n< Nicola >I'm from Upper Romana. My house is also
over there. I often get strange looks.

\n< Nicola >However, my loyalty to His Majesty and my
dedication to this country are genuine.
Please rest assured.

\n< Serena >I'm sorry. I didn't mean to imply anything.
I spoke rudely.
\n< Serena >Once again, I'm counting on you today.

\n< Nicola >Nice to meet you. Now, let's get straight to
the request...

\n< Nicola >I want you to infiltrate an illegal drug
trading site and secure the evidence...
in other words, the drugs themselves.
\n< Serena >Sneaking around is not my strong suit.

\n< Nicola >Ah, I phrased it poorly. Just simply
purchase it as a customer.

\n< Nicola >We need evidence for the arrest. However,
even if we intervene, it will be quickly
hidden.

\n< Serena >Why don't we just find it? I know of places
where it can be hidden in an instant.

\n< Nicola >That's right. However, I can't exactly ask you
to open up your stomach and show me
what's inside.

\n< Serena >If I were to swallow it? It's not like
illegal drugs are something decent.
\n< Nicola >Of course, it's the Inheritance Powder.
\n< Serena >？

\n< Nicola >Huh?... Ah, have you recently come to this
town?

\n< Nicola >Well, it can't be helped if you don't know.
It's an abnormal situation. Truly an
abnormal situation.

\n< Nicola >Currently, this town is contaminated with poison.
There is no way to stop the circulation
of poison.

\n< Nicola >There is a wicked scheme going on where
people are killing their families to
obtain inheritance and freedom. It has
caused a kind of epidemic.

\n< Serena >Speaking of which, I heard some rumors even in
the hot spring town...

\n< Serena >So, the name of that poison is Inheritance
Powder. Ridiculous.

\n< Nicola >Nowadays, housewives around here are getting
their hands on drugs while shopping and
attempting to poison their husbands by
mixing it in their dinner.

\n< Nicola >Everyone is a user, everyone is a seller, and
everyone can become a consumer.

\n< Nicola >This is also one of the trading places I
found this time.

\n< Nicola >We'll arrest them and crush them. But we need
evidence for that. In other words, we
need the actual Inheritance Powder
itself.

\n< Nicola >However, if we just barge in, it will be
immediately covered up. That's why we
have unidentified accomplices.
\n< Serena >I see. I understand.
\n< Serena >However, hiding by swallowing the poison...

\n< Nicola >Inheritance Powder is a poison that only becomes
harmful when it accumulates and remains
in the body.

\n< Nicola >On the contrary, if you were to swallow a
large amount at once and immediately
vomit it out, there would be no problem.
\n< Serena >That sounds like a ridiculous argument.

\n< Nicola >Many people actually die from it. But it has
already spread as an effective method.

\n< Nicola >The source of circulation... From the
perspective of neighbors, silencing the
sellers might be fine in its own way.
\n< Serena >Neighbors?

\n< Nicola >The root cause of this situation. We are
tentatively calling them the true
culprit behind the circulation of the
poison.

\n< Nicola >That person should be hiding somewhere in
this town, pretending to be innocent.

\n< Nicola >Our final goal as the patrol team is to
arrest that person... but...
\n< Nicola >...Excuse me.

\n< Nicola >Subordinate Zee! What are you hesitating for! If
you have a report, spit it out quickly!
\n< Nicola >...Hmm. Hmm... I understand.

\n< Nicola >I've received a report. It seems that a
transaction is happening right now.

\n< Nicola >They say haste makes waste. Is it alright to
head there immediately?
\n< Serena >No problem.

\n< Nicola >...I appreciate that you've been quick to
talk since earlier. Have you become
interested in the patrol team?

\n< Serena >I haven't done it. I have a lot of other
things to do... I'm currently busy.

\n< Nicola >I see... That's unfortunate. The patrol
team is always short-staffed, you know.

\n< Nicola >If you're a talented individual, we
welcome you anytime. We're directly
under the command of His Majesty the
King, and the treatment is not bad
either.

\n< Nicola >Although we often face unnecessary interference
because of that...

\n< Nicola >...Alright. Let's head to the scene. Subordinates
Zee, make sure you have your tools ready
and come later.
ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー
２７文字で改行
ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー
ストーリー　警邏隊のターゲット

\n< Serena >Lord Nicola, I heard that you have a
request.

\n< Nicola >So you've come. Well, let's get straight
to the point...

\n< Nicola >...I want to talk... but... Serena, what
about your... stomach?
\n< Serena >.......

\n< Serena >I'm not in perfect condition, but I can
still fight. Please don't worry about
me.
\n< Nicola >...Fight with that stomach...?

\n< Nicola >...No, I'm saying that professionals can
handle it. It would be rude to interrupt
you instead.
\n< Nicola >Alright. Let me continue the conversation.
\n< Nicola >Ah, Serena. You came. I've been waiting.

\n< Nicola >I apologize for my appearance. I got
blood splattered on my coat.
\n< Serena >Were you attacked?

\n< Nicola >No, we were the ones who attacked. Thanks
to that, the investigation has
progressed further. It is also related
to why I called you...
\n< Nicola >Shall we get to the main point?

\n< Nicola >There's a guy named G who's been selling
inheritance drugs in a flashy manner.

\n< Nicola >It seems that the guys you caught the
other day were also getting drugs from
this G.
\n< Serena >Hmmm. So, you're saying he's a drug dealer?

\n< Nicola >Ah, if we can get information about the
drug supplier from this person, the
investigation should make significant
progress... I hope.

\n< Nicola >However, the hideout we finally managed to grasp
seems to be located in the sewer.

\n< Nicola >Our investigative authority does not extend
to the sewer. The water system is the
lifeline of the city. If outsiders like
us were to enter, it would cause
trouble.

\n< Nicola >However, we can't just let G go. This is a
valuable lead to the Neighbor we finally
found. If we let this person escape, the
investigation will be back to square
one.
\n< Serena >So, is it my turn now?

\n< Nicola >Ah, if it's in the form of a request to
adventurers, the City Council and the
city police won't complain.

\n< Nicola >You might feel like I'm bringing
nonsensical conflicts into the
investigation of crimes from your
perspective...

\n< Serena >No, actually it's a grateful story for me.
Thanks to this, I can get work like
this.
\n< Nicola >I'm glad to hear you say that.

\n< Nicola >Slimes have also settled in the city's sewer.
Please be careful during the
exploration.

\n< Serena >Understood... However, I wonder how this G person is
using the slimes' habitat as their
hideout?

\n< Nicola >It's unclear. However, we should be able to
understand once we catch them.

\n< Nicola >Well, that's the explanation of the request.
I've prepared a reward of 900 S.
\n< Nicola >Can you take on this request?
Yes
No
Yes

\n< Serena >Ah, I want you to leave it to me. I promise
to bring back good news.
\n< Nicola >Thank you. You are really reliable.

\n< Nicola >The entrance to the sewer is in the
southeast of the city. It's in a
cluttered area.
\n< Nicola >Please head over as soon as you're ready.
No

\n< Serena >I'm sorry. Please give me a moment to
think.

\n< Nicola >...Understood. I won't force you. Let me know when
you've made up your mind.
\n< Nicola >......Serena, um... how's your stomach?
\n< Serena >.......

\n< Serena >My condition is not perfect, but I can
still fight. Please don't worry about me
unnecessarily.

\n< Nicola >...I see. If it were someone else, I would
stop them... but it's your decision. I
will respect it.

\n< Nicola >So, what do you think? Can you take on the
request to explore the sewer?
Yes
No
Yes
\n< Serena >Yes, I will do it.
\n< Nicola >...Good. I'm relieved.

\n< Nicola >The entrance to the sewer is in the
southeast of the town. It's in a messy
district. I think it's called the City
Dungeon.
\n< Nicola >Please head there as soon as you're ready.
No
\n< Serena >I'm sorry. Just a little longer.
\n< Nicola >I see...
終了

\n< Nicola >Gee is in the sewer. Please head towards
the southeast section of the city.

\n< Nicola >I asked you for a favor... You're
pregnant. Please be careful during the
search.

\n< Nicola >Gee is in the sewer. Please head towards
the southeast section of the city.
終了

\n< Nicola >...Yes, excellent work.

\n< Nicola >I asked a pregnant person to do something
reckless, but they delivered the
expected results.

\n< Nicola >It was the right decision to leave it to
you after all. Thank you, Serena.

\n< Serena >Yes, well... it ended with a slightly sore
ass...
\n< Nicola >Ass?
\n< Serena >N-No, it's nothing.

\n< Nicola >I'm not sure, but... well, the signing is
done. Here's the contract. Please take
it.

\n< Nicola >Now, here's the signed request document.
Please take it.

\n< Serena >Hmm... With this, will the spread of the
inheritance drug be contained?

\n< Nicola >By capturing Ghee? That would be
impossible.

\n< Nicola >That person is not the center of the
situation. There are others who are
imitating like a merchant.

\n< Nicola >Well, that's true. There's no doubt that they
are an important witness.

\n< Nicola >There must be neighbors lurking somewhere
along the distribution route that Ghee
was involved in.
\n< Nicola >At least there are no clues.

\n< Nicola >First, make Ghee reveal the source of the
poison. Then make the person who knows
the source reveal it as well. And
gradually, little by little, unravel the
thread...

\n< Nicola >Eventually, I will definitely trace it back to the
mastermind. I will put an end to the
distribution of this poison, such as the
inheritance drug.

\n< Serena >Ah, Lord Nicola should be able to
accomplish it.

\n< Serena >I also have my own circumstances, so I
can't fully cooperate...

\n< Serena >If it's something within my capabilities,
let me help again.

\n< Nicola >I would like to ask for your help as
well.

\n< Nicola >Next, I intend to give you an even bigger
request. The reward will be commensurate
with that.
\n< Nicola >...Of course, if you're okay with it, but...
\n< Serena >......Ah.

\n< Serena >By that time, I should also have become
more agile... Please don't hesitate to
assign me tasks.
\n< Serena >Well then, until next time.

\n< Nicola >Next, I intend to give you an even bigger
request. Of course, the reward will be
commensurate with that.

\n< Serena >Heh. Let me have high expectations. Well
then.
CommonPopupManager.showInfo({},"I got the 900S.",null)
\n< Serena >Nn... Ah...
\n< Serena >Well, I've managed to save up some funds.

\n< Serena >Should I use this money to repay my debt to
Madam, or should I use it for the
investigation of Splendore...

\n< Serena >If I were to use it for the investigation,
I would first need to find an
information broker.
\n< Serena >A reliable information broker...
\n< Serena >....

\n< Serena >......Regardless of what we decide, let's go home for
today.
\n< Serena >It's time for work. Today, as always.
\n< Serena >Haa... My ass hurts...
\n< Nicola >Hey, Serena. How are you doing?

\n< Serena >Lord Nicola, how is the progress of the
investigation?
\n< Nicola >Serena, huh?

\n< Nicola >It's technically classified information,
but...

\n< Serena >It's just a polite expression. I don't
really intend to pry.

\n< Nicola >Oh, it's good timing. Listen, I want to
organize my thoughts.

\n< Serena >I don't mind, but is it okay?
Confidential information and all...
\n< Nicola >I assume you're the one who asked.

\n< Nicola >The investigation of the poison. Let me be
clear. I thought the culprit was the
noble of the city, Goupil.

\n< Nicola >But it was different. It seems I was
mistaken.
\n< Serena >Hmmm...

\n< Serena >Huh, Goupil? Then, what about that request I
was involved in?

\n< Nicola >Ah, the investigation of Goupil was a
request from the patrol team. Were you
also helping out? It wasn't mentioned in
the report.

\n< Serena >Well, I wouldn't say I helped, more like I
just got in the way...

\n< Nicola >Anyway, that Goupil. He's the master of the
Butcher Guild, but his actions are
really suspicious, you know.

\n< Nicola >The more I dig, the more suspicions pile
up. I've sent people running in all
directions and gathered enough
circumstantial evidence to be about 90%
certain.

\n< Nicola >If there's one last push, if there's
conclusive evidence... I asked you
adventurers from the guild to procure
that decisive evidence...

\n< Nicola >...However, what came out was evidence of just
embezzlement. That's all.

\n< Nicola >Well, as the meat merchant in charge of the
city's food supply, I was involved in
some quite shady business that is not
acceptable.

\n< Nicola >Selling pigs with swine fever as healthy pigs,
and importing livestock from outside the
city without inspection...

\n< Nicola >It's good that justice has been served
there. It's good, but...
\n< Serena >The investigation is just the beginning.
\n< Nicola >I have such a headache.

\n< Nicola >No matter what route I trace the
distribution of the poison, it always
abruptly stops halfway.

\n< Nicola >It's a large-scale, meticulous, and well-
planned organized crime. It's a crime
that can only be committed by someone
with power and organizational skills
like Goupil.

\n< Nicola >I used quite a bit of influence to bring
up Goupil. It's going to be quite a
hassle to start investigating the other
members of the council now.

\n< Nicola >......Huh?......Oh? So that's why? Goupil was a decoy?
Perhaps even used to eliminate political
enemies?

\n< Nicola >The real culprit is someone else from the
council.... Are they laughing
triumphantly by now....

\n< Serena >Is it certain that someone from the city
council is the culprit?

\n< Nicola >...Actually, there is no concrete evidence for that.
However, who else could distribute
poison on such a large scale?

\n< Nicola >The culprit is a member of the urban
aristocracy... or someone close to it. A
person of influence. A person with
power. They shouldn't be just an
ordinary person.

\n< Nicola >The purpose of spreading the poison is
still unclear... but without a backing,
an ordinary person wouldn't be able to
navigate through this situation. They
shouldn't be able to gain any benefits
either.

\n< Nicola >There must always be a motive for a crime.
And there must be someone who gains
benefits from it. There should be... for
a crime of this scale, it can't be just
a random act of mischief.

\n< Nicola >If we can see the motive... if we can
understand the culprit's interests...
then we might be able to make some
progress in the investigation...

\n< Nicola >Haah... It feels like being told there's
another round after going all-in and
thinking the game was over.

\n< Nicola >I was confident in the theory that Goupil
was the culprit...
\n< Serena >.......
\n< Nicola >Alright!

\n< Nicola >I feel better after just letting it all
out!
\n< Nicola >I'm sorry, Serena-kun. Bear with me.
\n< Serena >Hmm... Well, I was just listening quietly...

\n< Nicola >There's no point in lamenting. We just have to
do what needs to be done.

\n< Nicola >No matter how far the road ahead may seem,
there's nothing to gain from hesitating
to take that first step.
\n< Serena >Yeah... That's completely true.

\n< Nicola >Neighbor huh... I'll definitely grab hold of
their tail. Since they exist, we can't
erase their traces...
ストーリー　捕縛後の相談

\n< Nicola >I have already hinted at it in the guild.
Please come and receive your reward.

\n< Nicola >I hope that your goal is achieved safely,
Serena- sama.

\n< Serena >Um... Where is Catherine right now?

\n< Serena >Excuse me. I would like to meet with Lord

\n< Patrol Team >Ah, Serena-san. Thank you for your hard

\n< Serena >Alright, let's head to the headquarters. Even

\n< Patrol Team >If we can defeat them there, the remaining

particular.

\n< Patrol Team >We will rush into their stronghold and
rescue Captain Nicola.

\n< Serena >However, it's reassuring that you rely on me,
but I am someone who was once defeated
by them.

\n< Patrol Team >That's true, but right now we don't have any
other options.
\n< Serena >Tell me.

\n< Patrol Team >It will be a gamble of whether we succeed
or fail.
\n< Patrol Team >Please let us know when you're ready.
27-sub2 ニコラ　勝利
\n< Nicola >First, Serena-kun. I want you to take this.

\n< Serena >...Is this... a loan document? Did I... do
this to the mansion lord...

\n< Serena >I was a little curious about where it
went, indeed.

\n< Nicola >It seems that they found that document
among the materials confiscated at the
brothel...
娼館のマダムがどういうつもりでその証文を
破棄もせず保管していたのかは知らないが…
第三者に渡ると非常に面倒な事になる。
\n<ニコラ>
事実、なりかけていた。
連中これを娼館で見つけたらしくてね。
\n<ニコラ>
…これは。借金の証文？
私が館長殿にした……。
\n<セレナ>
確かにどこへ行ったものか、少し気にはなっていたが。
\n<セレナ>
連中、娼館で押収した資料の中から
その証文を見つけたらしくてな……。
\n<ニコラ>

\n< Nicola >If something like this were to fall into
the hands of those unscrupulous people,
you would be in quite a predicament,
wouldn't you?

\n< Serena >So, you want me to retrieve the loan
document by myself...?

\n< Nicola >It's a personal matter for a friend... I
can't involve the patrol team.

\n< Serena >That's not the point! Why didn't you tell me
about this!

\n< Serena >I'm not happy about any of this! Even if
something like this happens...!

\n< Nicola >I will be leaving the town, but it seems
you still have business in this town.

\n< Nicola >I have determined that it would be best
for me to take care of everything and
bring it to an end.

\n< Nicola >I never thought that the sword would
become so dull due to the effects of the
medicine...

\n< Nicola >So in the end, I ended up troubling you,
Serena- kun. It's all so confusing.
Honestly...
\n< Serena >.......
\n< Nicola >Well, subordinate Zee.
\n< Patrol Team >Yes!

\n< Nicola >Please deliver this letter to the council.
Hurry.
\n< Patrol Team >Yes!
\n< Serena >What was that just now?
\n< Nicola >Hm? Ah... I wonder if this is a report.

\n< Nicola >I wrote down the circumstances of the
fight with the patrol team. Of course, I
didn't mention your name.

\n< Nicola >I decided to create a commotion by
dueling in order to protect my honor,
after being raped by Demuran... or
rather, today.
\n< Serena >That is...

\n< Nicola >I will be in a legal battle with Demuran
for a while. During that time, he won't
be able to do as he pleases.

\n< Nicola >Both my subordinate and the city police
should behave themselves for a while.
\n< Nicola >Your actions will not be restricted.

\n< Nicola >Well, I did beat him up so much. Physically,
he won't be able to move for a while.

\n< Serena >What will happen to Lord Nicola's honor?
What about the honor of our family?

\n< Nicola >Well, there's no helping it. Although the
order of events may be different, both
losing and being raped are facts.
\n< Nicola >There's no point in hiding it now...

\n< Nicola >H-However, I don't know how the trial will turn
out, but depending on the circumstances,
I might end up marrying that man. Just
thinking about it gives me chills.

\n< Serena >That is... Are you suggesting we make the
victim and the perpetrator a couple and
pretend the crime never happened...?

\n< Nicola >It seems that in a trial, the priority is
often given to the doctrine and
teachings.

\n< Nicola >Well, let's pray that a reasonable judge will
be assigned to the trial.
\n< Serena >.......

\n< Nicola >Well then, it's about time for us to take
our leave. The trial won't start for a
while... Before that, we have to deliver
our neighbor to the capital city.

\n< Nicola >It's a request from His Majesty. It pains me
to leave without being able to repay
you, who have done me such a great
favor...

\n< Serena >I never intended to sell my gratitude in
the first place. Please don't worry
about it.

\n< Nicola >We can't afford to do that. However,
arguing about it here won't get us
anywhere.

\n< Nicola >Someday, I will definitely repay you for what
happened today. Thank you, Serena.
\n< Serena >Hmm. Again, someday.

\n< Serena >The patrol... This is goodbye with Lord
Nicola, huh.

\n< Serena >I think we can consider the trouble with
the city police force settled for now.
At least, for me.
\n< Serena >Let's focus on Splendore from now on.
